description: Ultimately from Arabic عَالِمَة‎ (ʕālima, “singer”), originally a feminine adjective meaning ‘learned, knowledgeable’, from عَلِمَ‎ (ʕalima, “to know”).

entries.meaning: An Egyptian singer or dancing-girl used for entertainment; a dancing-girl, a prostitute. [from 18th c.]
examples: Nostalgia is almah, the Arab dancing girl. She tells me stories of the drowned, the deadest of this world's dead.
